item.description: Quick reminder: how to increase the copy-paste buffers size in iTerm2.

item.title: SRE 123
item.description: Everyone is all on fire about SRE. But what is it really? It’s as easy as 1-2-3 if you boil it down to the basics.

item.title: Fixing Hugo Social Media Icons in Blackburn
item.description: The Blackburn theme for Hugo has a bug in how it shows social media icons. Here’s how to fix it.

item.title: Fixing Hugo Images
item.description: Hugo made a change that broke image embedding using tags. Here’s how to fix it.

item.title: Hello Ubuntu - Kinda
item.description: Debian not good for me on the desktop - back to Ubuntu, lost the snaps.

item.description: The Raspberry Pi Zero W is likely the basis of my next few projects.

item.title: Goodbye Ubuntu, Hello Debian my old friend
item.description: Ubuntu just went too far with the snap crap. Back to Debian!

item.title: Blast from the past - Linux Telephony API
item.description: A trip down memory lane: the first linux telephony drivers

item.title: Docs as Code
item.description: One of the core principles of modern “DevOps” development is to treat your documentation as code, just like code. My team at Cisco open sourced how we do that.

item.title: Terraform in AWS: use AMI Names not IDs - and is Terraform the right answer still?
item.description: In AWS the AMI ID for a particular VM image is unique to that region. But it’s name is consistent across AWS. When building infra-as-code (such as terraform) use the name, not the ID. And some musings on terraform. Is it still the right answer for infra-as-code?

item.description: Quick reminder how to enable RDP sessions from OSX to an Ubuntu box.

item.title: SSH Tunnels
item.description: SSH tunnels are basically indistinguishable from magic.

item.title: Ubuntu Lid Control
item.description: The default behavior of Ubuntu 18.04 is not friendly for a notebook that swaps back and forth from desk to mobile.

item.title: Cloudy DevOps - Part 1
item.description: What exactly is Cloudy DevOps? How do you go from classic data center Enterprise deployments to the cloud? Here’s some of what I’ve learned across a half-dozen teams who’ve done it.

item.title: Boards!
item.description: I’m building a robotics board that basically is a WiFi REST interface to a variety of I2C sensors - the I2C side uses an I2C switch driven by an ESP32. My first RBOT board arrived, but alas, I got schooled on surface mount part numbering.

item.title: Ubuntu Again!
item.description: From 1997 to 2010 I believed it was only a matter of time before Linux on the desktop became a reality. I gave up in 2010 and went to OSX. But we may finally be close! Here’s my notes on installing Linux Ubuntu 18.04 on a Dell Inspiron 15 7000. It’s the easiest and happiest linux ever for me.
